page.title: 05RETTENDON CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Church is dated from the 13th century, the tower is 15th century. In the north aisle is the Humphrey Memorial which is 10 metres high and is made of marble. The 15th century choir benches have animals carved on them. There is a good view from the top of the tower.On the east you can see the Crouch Estuary. There is a priest's room which leads, by a spiral staircase, to a flat stone fragment of an intresting coffin lid, dating from the early 13th century. The oldest thing in the church is a slab of stone, which is from the late Norman period, it is beautifully carved with birds and leaves.
